Name: Siege of the Alcázar
WarName: – Second Spanish Republic militias besieged the Alcázar of Toledo in the Spanish Civil War

Name: Siege of Jerusalem
WarName: – 1948 Arab–Israeli War – Palestinian Arabs laid siege to the Jewish quarters of Jerusalem, but were driven back. Siege was resumed in May by regular Jordanian and Egyptian forces. Ended in armistice.

Name: Berlin Blockade
WarName: – No military action, but the tactic to starve a city by cutting her supply lines is a feature of a siege. The famous Berlin Air Lift supplied the city with food, coal, medical supplies and other goods for nearly a year.

Name: Siege of Dien Bien Phu
WarName: – Vietnamese Viet Minh forces besieged French forces, effecting a final defeat on France's colonial occupation.

Name: Siege of Erenköy
WarName: – Turkish Cypriots holding out against attacking Greek and Greek Cypriot forces. Turkish invasion of Cyprus

Name: Siege of the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem
Siege of the Luhansk Border Base
